title: alias bound candidates for opaques are unsound

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-unsound
labels.description: Issue: A soundness hole (worst kind of bug), see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soundness

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

labels.name: T-types
labels.description: Relevant to the types team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
#![feature(type_alias_impl_trait)]

trait Trait<T> {
    type Assoc: Default;
}

type Ty<T> = impl Trait<T>;
    
impl<T> Trait<T> for T
where
    <Ty<T> as Trait<T>>::Assoc: Default,
{
    type Assoc = <Ty<T> as Trait<T>>::Assoc;
}

#[allow(unused)]
fn define<T>(x: T) -> Ty<T> { x }

fn main() {
    let _ = <() as Trait<()>>::Assoc::default();
}
```

<details>
<summary>passes cargo check and results in an ICE</summary>

```
error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/normalize_erasing_regions.rs:195:90: Failed to normalize fn() -> <Ty<()> as Trait<()>>::Assoc {<<Ty<()> as Trait<()>>::Assoc as std::default::Default>::default}, maybe try to call `try_normalize_erasing_regions` instead

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.70.0-nightly (da7c50c08 2023-03-19) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [mir_drops_elaborated_and_const_checked] elaborating drops for `main`
#1 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `main`
#2 [collect_and_partition_mono_items] collect_and_partition_mono_items
end of query stack
error: could not compile `playground` (bin "playground")
```

</details>

This has the same underlying reason as the unsoundness for [super traits with coinduction](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=94608b51cad595eebeeb4597aff3a4a9) and [alias bound for projections](https://github.com/lcnr/solver-woes/issues/9#issuecomment-1456284249). To my knowledge none of these issues are exploitable on stable right now though.

This relies on the following unsound circular reasoning:
- the impl of `Trait<T> for T` relies on the item bound `Ty<T>: Trait<T>`
- proving the item bounds for the underlying type of `Ty<T>` (`T`) uses the impl
